name: bigarade
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a brown sauce made with bitter oranges and sugar, often served with duck (= the meat of a water bird): I like to serve pan-fried duck breasts with a Bigarade sauce. The chef turns out French specialities such as a heavenly duck for two in a sauce de bigarade.
More examplesFewer examplesOranges feature as regularly as lemons in their recipes: the famous French classic bigarade sauce served with duck, for example.Bigarade is a sweet-sour brown sauce, flavoured with orange peel and juice, and usually served with roast duck.The custom of flavouring roast duck with the rind and juice of bitter oranges, so popular in France as sauce bigarade, probably originated in Italy.
